result.execSummary:
The defendant John T. Oberjat was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall write a letter of apology to A.O. due within 30 days of sentencing and preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall obtain his HSED/GED or adult diploma at agent's discretion.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with any recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John T. Oberjat

Defendant John T. Oberjat in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into record.  Victim notification has been complied.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to the charge of DC.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders withheld sentence probation for one year; court costs; DNA surcharge; AODA; letter of apology to A.O.  due within 30 days and preapproved by probation; counseling as deemed appropriate; obtain HSED/GED or adult diploma at agent's discretion.  - rt

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall have no contact with A.O. - d.o.b. 2-28-34.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John T. Oberjat appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requested $2,000.00 signature bond; booking and no contact with A.O. - dob:  2-28-34.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Court advised defendant of right to an attorney.  Court ordered the clerk to begin bond revocations proceeding in Case No. 15CM27.  Next court date is June 30, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt
